list-item.p: Maximum likelihood phylogenetic reconstruction coupled with several combinations of bootstrap support and genetic distance requirements for clades, termed the ML-bootstrap approach,
Bayesian phylogenetic inference, coupled with several combinations of posterior probability support and genetic distance requirement for clades,
DM-PhyClus [ 9], a Bayesian method that defines chains as sets of sequences supported by subtrees with distinctive branch length distributions,
The Gap Procedure [ 10], a non-phylogenetic distance-based approach that requires chains to be reasonably distinctive from one another.
